alert.note: Alert for Bandera; Blanco; Burnet; Edwards; Gillespie; Kendall; Kerr; Kinney; Llano; Medina; Real; Uvalde; Val Verde (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued January 17 at 2:02AM CST until January 18 at 8:00PM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions Expected Wednesday afternoon over the Southern Edwards Plateau and Hill Country... A cold front will pass through the region during the early to mid morning hours on Wednesday. Gusty 15 to 25 MPH northwest winds will develop by early afternoon over Hill Country and the southern Edwards Plateau, which will combine with minimum relative humidities in the mid to upper teens and dry fuels to create critical fire weather conditions. Persons in these regions should avoid any activities that could inadvertently lead to the ignition and spread of wildfires tomorrow afternoon. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR HILL COUNTRY AND THE SOUTHERN EDWARDS PLATEAU... The National Weather Service in Austin/San Antonio has issued a Fire Weather Watch for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from Wednesday afternoon through Wednesday evening. * WINDS...Northwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Any wildfires that develop could be difficult to control and will likely spread rapidly.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
